pageProps.content:
![High1 Resort (ÌïòÏù¥Ïõê Î¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏)](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1982091_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Named to reflect the concept ‚Äúfirst and foremost,‚Äù High1 is a multipurpose leisure resort consisting of High1 Resort, Kangwon Land Convention Hotel, Kangwon Land Casino, High1 Grand Hotel Main Tower, High1 Ski, High1 C.C., High1 Hotel, Valley Condominium, and Mountain Condominium. The ski resort, one of the most popular parts of the High1 complex, offers a 4.2 kilometer-long slope for beginners that runs from the summit of Jijangsan Mountain (altitude 1,345 meters). The ski resort has a total of 18 slopes, 3 gondolas, and 7 lifts.

The two hotels and three condominiums at High1 house a total of 1,577 rooms. Frequented by both Korean and non-Korean travelers, High1 also boasts an 18-hole golf course and Unamjeong, a traditional Korean restaurant. Nearby tourist sites include Jeongseon Rail Bike, Ararichon, Auraji, Gariwangsan Recreational Forest, Jeongseon 5-day Market, Mindungsan Mountain, Donggang River, Jeongseon Sogeumgang River, and Hwaamdonggul Cave. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-1588-7789| |parking:|Available (6,287 parking spaces)| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-09-28-1664358710308/693242_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/693242_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664358710308/904791_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/904791_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1583457_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1583457_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1583459_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1583459_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1982074_image2_1.webp](/2022-09-28-1664358710308/1982074_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-1588-7789](tel:+8215887789) - [üè†www.high1.com]( http://www.high1.com/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.2067220484 longitude: 128.8377247370 title: 424, High1-gil, Jeongseon-gun, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus + Taxi]
From Dong Seoul Bus Terminal, take a bus to Gohan Intercity Bus Terminal.
From Gohan Intercity Bus Terminal, take a taxi for approx. 10 min.

data.title: High1 Resort (ÌïòÏù¥Ïõê Î¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏)
data.description:
Named to reflect the concept ‚Äúfirst and foremost,‚Äù High1 is a multipurpose leisure resort consisting of High1 Resort, Kangwon Land Convention Hotel, Kangwon Land Casino, High1 Grand Hotel Main Tower, High1 Ski, High1 C.C., High1 Hotel, Valley Condominium, and Mountain Condominium. The ski resort, one of the most popular parts of the High1 complex, offers a 4.2 kilometer-long slope for beginners that runs from the summit of Jijangsan Mountain (altitude 1,345 meters). The ski resort has a total of 18 slopes, 3 gondolas, and 7 lifts.

The two hotels and three condominiums at High1 house a total of 1,577 rooms. Frequented by both Korean and non-Korean travelers, High1 also boasts an 18-hole golf course and Unamjeong, a traditional Korean restaurant. Nearby tourist sites include Jeongseon Rail Bike, Ararichon, Auraji, Gariwangsan Recreational Forest, Jeongseon 5-day Market, Mindungsan Mountain, Donggang River, Jeongseon Sogeumgang River, and Hwaamdonggul Cave.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Ojukheon House (Í∞ïÎ¶â Ïò§Ï£ΩÌóå)
dataList.description:
Ojukheon House was where Yi I (penname Yulgok; scholar and politician of the Joseon Period) was born. It was built during the early Joseon dynasty and was designated as Treasure No. 165 in 1963 for its historical value.

Inside the house is Mongryongsil, where Yi I was born. The household complex also features the household shrine, Munseongsa, the sarangchae (mens quarters), Eojaegak Pavilion, Yulgok Memorial Hall, and Gangneung Municipal Museum. Since 1961, the city of Gangneung has held a memorial ceremony at Yulgok Memorial Hall on October 25-26.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Odaesan National Park (Ïò§ÎåÄÏÇ∞Íµ≠Î¶ΩÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description:
Odaesan Mountain is located in the central and eastern part of Gangwon-do. The mountain was designated a national park in February 1975, including an area of 298.5 „é¢ centered on the highest peak, Birobong Peak (alt. 1,563 meters). Other peaks include Horyeongbong, Sangwangbong, Dongdaesan, and Durobong.

Odaesan Mountain has the largest natural forest of Korea, home to many wild animals and plants. The mountain is divided into smaller sections Odaesan Section, Bangadari Bridge Section, Byeongnae-ri Section, Hwangbyeongsan Mountain Section, Hongcheon-myeon Section, and Sogeumgang River Section. It is also rich in soil and resources, with lush forests and gentle slopes.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: National Center for Forest Activities Chuncheon (Íµ≠Î¶ΩÏ∂òÏ≤úÏà≤Ï≤¥Ïõê)
dataList.description: National Center for Forest Activities Chuncheon is 335 ha of area located near Samhangol Valley. The center has a slogan PLAY meaning P for Play, L for Lead, A for Act, and Y for You. Various facilities are available including area for experience programs, accommodations, restaurants and more. Experience programs for individuals and groups are available as well as special programs for people with disabilities and elderlies.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namhangjin Beach (ÎÇ®Ìï≠ÏßÑÌï¥Î≥Ä(ÎÇ®Ìï≠ÏßÑÌï¥ÏàòÏöïÏû•))
dataList.description:
Namhangjin Beach is a white sandy beach covering an area of 24,000 „é° and a length of 600 meters. Near the beach, there is a number of hoetjip (raw fish restaurant) with spacious parking lots. In addition, the dense pine tree forest and neat accommodations are other attractive features of this place.

Namhangjin Port is the where the Seomseokcheon Stream meets the Namdaecheon Stream. The name Namhangjin originated from an old port in Songjeong, which was located on a street leading south to Hansongsa Temple.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namdaecheon Stream (ÎÇ®ÎåÄÏ≤ú)
dataList.description: This stream is taken as the first among the Eight Sights of Yangyang. Originating from Odaesan Mountain (1,563 m) in Pyeongchang-gun, Gangwon-do, this river flows through Yangyang and into the East Sea. The stream is divided into five areas; the upper stream, Buyeon Valley, Beopsuchiri Valley, Eoseongjeoncheon Stream, and Namdaecheon Stream. Namdaecheon Stream is the foremost site for salmon run in Korea, with more than 70% of salmon in Korea returning to this ‚Äúriver mother of salmons.‚Äù Salmon fry hatching here spend about 3 to 5 years in Bering or the Sea of Okhotsk, and return to the East Sea to run the river and lay their eggs at the end of their lives. Salmon run in Namdaecheon Stream reaches its x_height in mid-October to November, and is celebrated by Yangyang Salmon Festival held in mid-October. Other fish sightings include the big-scaled redfin in April and May, and sweetfish in July and August. Namdaecheon Stream is said to be the clearest and the longest stream in Yeongdong region of Gangwon-do  while other streams are about 20 km long, Namdaecheon Stream has a total length of 54 km and many other distributaries. It is also home to tourist sites like the Beopsuchiri Valley and Naksan Beach, and Namdaecheon Eco Trail at the delta is known for its silver reeds in fall.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namaehang Port (ÎÇ®Ïï†Ìï≠)
dataList.description: The largest port in Yangyang area is also one of the Eight Sights of Yangyang, and along with Simgokhang Port of Gangneung and Chogokhang Port of Samcheok, said to be the three most beautiful ports in Gangwon-do. Indeed, its reputation can be seen in the picturesque view of the white and red lighthouse, breakwater, and the fishing boats docked at the port. Another point of interest at Namaehang Port is the Namaehang Skywalk Observatory. Located at the entrance to the breakwater, this observation point offers a breathtaking view of the Namaehang Port area and the East Sea. The island, where the skywalk is located, was called Yangyado Island during the Joseon period, and the site of this observation point used to have a beacon during the Joseon period. Namae Fishing Village Experience, a village that is fed by the Namaehang Port, offers fishing boat trips for visitors, along with hand fishing, rock crab catching, and stuffed squid making. Some of Namaehang Port‚Äôs major catches include squid, plaice, and flatfish. A line of restaurants specializing in raw fish slices allows visitors to enjoy the fresh catch right away.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namae Beach (Namae 1, 3-ri) (ÎÇ®Ïï†Ìï¥Î≥Ä(ÎÇ®Ïï†1, 3Î¶¨))
dataList.description:
In addition to the beautiful Maeho Lagoon at its side, Namae-ri is home to three beaches. The northernmost Namae Beach is the largest among the three, with a sandy shore that is 2 kilometers long and 100 meters wide. The beach has great quality sand and shallow waters, with an average depth of only 1 to 2 meters. Also, a field of reeds is beautifully stretched out on both sides of the stream flowing from Maeho Lagoon. Near Maeho Lagoon is the breeding ground for egrets and grey herons in Pomae-ri, designated as Natural Monument No. 229.

The other two beaches in Namae-ri consist of Namae 1(il)-ri Beach, a charming small beach in the furthest south, and Namae 3(sam)-ri Beach, located near Naemae Port.
dataList.author: korea-tour
